message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it addresses the task of assessing discourse coherence, which is an essential aspect of text quality and is relevant to many NLP tasks such as summarization and language assessment. The paper proposes a hierarchical neural network trained in a multi-task fashion to predict document-level coherence scores and word-level grammatical roles, which are both relevant to the field of computational linguistics. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves the prediction of varying degrees of coherence, which could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as well. Finally, the paper's use of a hierarchical neural network suggests that it could also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
